segments.text: What's your little caper ? Come home so late ! We are all worried about you .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , I am terribly sorry . But I was so captivated with the singer at the subway exit . So I forgot the time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Singing ? At the subway exit ? Oh , it sounds like someone needs some money .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , no , the guy was a musician who just sang . He played the guitar and sang so many cool pop songs . Many people were drawn to his music and there was no hat on the floor . He sang for appreciation , but not for money .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It is just pop song , you could have sung there too if you want it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , no , it was a kind of pop art . I like it but I couldn't do it that well .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Honey , just do it next time . Have you heard of the real art in the subway station in Russia ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , but tell me some . I am interested .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Many oil painting exhibitions are there . That is a kind of Museum Exhibition .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Are there many people there ? Do you think people actually like them ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am sure you will . There are some works , and some students who major in painting interpret the meaning for visitors . And people can enjoy the paintings while waiting for the train .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But I still prefer the pop music in the subway .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Both the pop music and the oil painting ate arts , but with different aesthetic values .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Dad , you talk well , but can you appreciate that kind of art ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Not well enough , but I'm learning .
segments.speaker: S1
